description.raw:
This PR extends our logging stuff to also mount .ros and .gazebo folders in the host machine and later upload the logs to S3. 

Besides uploading to S3 , the logs of each run world will be kept in the host instance at ~/code/simulator-logs/ folder.

This can be tested by creating a constellation using latest released AMIs, but before launching "
"World 1" (Run 1 button) you will need to change to branch `s3-ros-gazebo-logs` in the simulator instance.

Note: this PR also needs this change in widgets: #!/osrf/cloudsim-widgets/pull-requests/174/make-the-iso-timestamp-be-more-docker/diff

This PR extends our logging stuff to also mount .ros and .gazebo folders in the host machine and later upload the logs to S3.

Besides uploading to S3 , the logs of each run world will be kept in the host instance at ~/code/simulator-logs/ folder.

This can be tested by creating a constellation using latest released AMIs, but before launching " "World 1" (Run 1 button) you will need to change to branch s3-ros-gazebo-logs in the simulator instance.

Note: this PR also needs this change in widgets: #!/osrf/cloudsim-widgets/pull-requests/174/make-the-iso-timestamp-be-more-docker/diff

title.raw: Also store gazebo and ROS logs in S3
title.html: Also store gazebo and ROS logs in S3
